definition: to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
bow case or scabbard/to hide/military strategy
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
last day of a lunar month/dark/night

sentences.english: Even those Chinese who think we should continue to keep a low profile did not oppose sending military forces to Libya.
sentences.chinese: 即使那些坚持韬光养晦政策的中国人也不反对派兵。

sentences.english: China’s policy on Libya is clearly a break from the principle of keeping-low-profile.
sentences.chinese: 中国的利比亚政策是与韬光养晦原则的决裂。

sentences.english: Believe that, over time, stronger productions artists will rise once again.
sentences.chinese: 相信假以时日，韬光养晦，川籍艺术家将再次崛起。

sentences.english: This paper is on the main line of "Keeping a Low Profile" diplomatic strategy and has four parts.
sentences.chinese: 本文以“韬光养晦”外交战略为主线，共有四个部分。

definition: to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
avoiding doing something that one is clumsy at to save face
hibernation/living in seclusion
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
forethought
to show off one's ability
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
to recover/to recuperate
